reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: All costs associated with the medical support of volunteers in Zambia. Includes costs of medical staff and care, staff and Volunteer medical-related travel, Volunteer medevac accompaniment travel, medical supplies, and distinct medical unit costs.. The U.S. President’s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief – PEPFAR (Global Health Programs - GHP) aiming to reach sustainable control of the HIV/AIDS epidemic

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Despite its status as a lower-middle income country with mineral wealth, Zambia ranks poorly on human development indicators with child malnutrition and its rural poverty levels among the highest in the world. U.S. assistance to Zambia seeks to reduce poverty through the promotion of agriculture-led economic development and food security; combat deforestation and wildlife poaching; expand and improves the quality of health and education opportunities; fight HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis, and malaria; work to decrease maternal and child mortality; strengthen democratic and accountable governance; and build Zambian capacity to promote regional peace, security, and stability.

All headquarters and overseas costs associated with the medical support of Volunteers. Includes costs of medical staff and care, staff and Volunteer medical-related travel, Volunteer medevac accompaniment travel, medical supplies, and distinct medical unit costs.
